reviews.text: Room size - awesome; bathroom is its own wonder (wet room, illuminated bath...wasted on a business trip!) free soft drinks from minibar; free WiFi...I stay in a LOT of hotels both on corporate budgets, and at luxury end for personal trips - and this hotel is in my top 10...and depending on how the rest of the stay goes, top 5! I would personally pay full freight here if in Shanghai for leisure.

reviews.title: Modern, well-located, professional, clean
It's the small touches...
reviews.text: It's great to stay at a hotel that is pushing the boundaries of hospitality. From the moment you arrive, there are some great touches. Reception is not a desk, but a central console, where you feel very much at one with the process. They have a snack table there, which changes throughout the day and offers everything from sweets, to cookies and even wine in the evening. There is also complimentary coffee. Rooms are large, with free WiFi, tea/coffee (my only gripe is that the coffee is instant), large rain showers and even a cool Japanese toilet. The room also has complimentary soft drinks and snacks in the minibar and fruit. The Lobby has a homely feel to it, with books to read. There is a great gym and very cool glass swimming pool in the basement. The restaurant offered a nice selection of Asian and International cuisine. On one night there was a great "sampler" menu, enabling you to try out miniature dishes from the a la carte menu available on other nights. Staff are friendly, helpful and come with personality. A great hotel.

I'm surprised to see some average reviews of the Andaz, because I've just travelled for a solid month for business and this was far and away my favourite hotel. I'd happily recommend it for business or pleasure. The design of the building is fantastic - from the lobby, to the more casual and welcoming reception, right through to the bedrooms, bathrooms and spa/gym areas. I was really impressed every one of my 5 days there. The service was very efficient, helpful and surprisingly relaxed - nothing stiff or awkward about it. I loved the room - stylish, modern, with some lovely Asian touches and the bathroom, mood lighting and automated blinds were the right blend of practical, stylish and attractive. The views were great, the location of the hotel opposite Xintiandi was very convenient - it's central but also easy to walk across the road for a wander/shop/dinner after work. I only ate one night in the restaurant, but it was tasty and quick, breakfast was excellent every day. It wasn't until the last day that I visited the pool/spa area and wished I'd gone down earlier - really great set up.
reviews.title: Great by Design

Great Rooms, Lobby needs work
reviews.text: Having never stayed at an Andaz, I was pleasantly surprised by my stay. Rooms were modern/stylish, bathroom was cool and chic (though the shower didn't work perfectly) and the gym was excellent. The only complaints were in the lobby. First, the check-in/check-out counter is too casual, unorganized. A series of square kitchen block modules, guests are standing in each others way trying to check-in/check-out with absolutely no privacy as to one's personal details/hotel bill. Second, service in the lobby lounge was lacking, though this is probably a function of the difficulty of finding quality staff in a new hotel - I imagine this will get better over time. Nevertheless, I will stay here again and actually prefer it to the adjacent Langham Hotel.

I almost didn't want to leave to explore the city. Sunday brunch with champagne is a "must do". Will definately stay there again when returning to Shanghai.

High Tech
reviews.text: Great hotel. Wonderful reception from the staff on arrival who spoke very good English. Served me a beautiful coffee. The room was amazingly high tech from lighting, curtains, sound system, colour change shower, bath and sink. Had a fantastic view of the city. If you go all the way to Shanghai you must take the 8minute trip on the Magnetic train to the Airport. Wow it is fast... I will be back.
I liked the individual note, the service, the restaurants lot's of refreshing design details. The lobby service could be improved.

Can't ask for more
reviews.text: A model designer hotel by Hyatt Group right next to Xintaindi. Very helpful staff members. Ordered room services and the food came very speedy with great quality. Rooms are spacious with a modern contemporary design, especially with the mood lighting in the room and the bathroom. The only drawback is that the bed is not very comfortable. I am not sure it's just me or something wrong with the mattress. I was in excruciating pain two nights in a row after I woke up. :(

description: The first Andaz in Asia is located in Xintiandi—a landmark entertainment area in the heart of downtown Shanghai, internationally acclaimed for its restored Shikumen architecture housing stylish restaurants, bars, and boutiques. Andaz Shanghai is a short walk to the Metro and the prestigious Huai Hai Zhong Road, one of Shanghai’s premier shopping areas.The newly constructed 28-storey hotel features 307 spacious guest rooms measuring 41 square metres, including 47 premium rooms and suites ranging from 80–740 square metres, all with vibrant views over Shanghai and impressive LED lighting where guests can customise the colour to suit their mood. As in all Andaz hotels, non-alcoholic minibar drinks and snacks, local telephone calls and wireless internet access are complimentary.
